About me

I worked on a variety of sequence generative modeling and protein property prediction tasks that culminated in my doctoral thesis titled “Modern Machine Learning Methods for Protein Design”. I was advised by Richard Bonneau and Kyunghyun Cho at NYU in the Computer Science department of the Courant Institute.

Most of my PhD work stems from my time at Prescient Design, where I was a founding member1 from the early startup days through the acquisition by and integration into Genentech/Roche. Prior to Prescient/NYU I worked in the Systems Biology group, at the time led by Dr. Bonneau, and worked closely with the protein structure/function outfit including Vlad Gligorijević.

Before that, I completed an accelerated Master’s at UVM in computer science advised by James Bagrow with work on understanding causal attribution networks.

Education

  • PhD, New York University, 2025
  • MSc, University of Vermont, 2019
  • BS Mathematics, University of Vermont, 2017

  1. I was employee #$n$, where $0 < n \leq 2$. Depends what your criteria is for “first” … first to sign their offer letter? first to join the Slack? ↩
